question:
Consider the following statements about the Traditional Knowledge Digital Library (TKDL):
  1. It aims to prevent exploitation Indian traditional medicine knowledge from wrongful patents
  2. The implementation agency of the TKDL Project is the Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR)
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: Traditional Knowledge Digital Library (TKDL) is a collaborative project between Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR), Ministry of Science and Technology and Department of Ayurveda, Yoga & Naturopathy, Unani, Siddha and Homoeopathy (AYUSH), Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. It aims to prevent exploitation and to protect Indian traditional knowledge from wrongful patents. TKDL contains Indian traditional medicine knowledge available in public domain and pertains to classical/ traditional books related to Ayurveda, Unani and Siddha in a digitized format and is available in five international languages (English, French, German, Spanish and Japanese). The council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR) is the implementing agency of the project. Under the Scheme funds are provided only to CSIR, and no funds have been allocated/ released to any State under the Scheme.
